title: Mentor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Big Brothers Big Sisters (Calgary, AB) in Sept 2022
Interview Descriptions: Quite long but interesting. Basically dig everything about you. I don’t mind that. Children’s mental condition need that much work. It’s nice that they want to make sure you will be fine for the kids.
Interview Questions: What’s your relationship with your parents, kids, partner and friends

title: Mentoring Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Big Brothers Big Sisters in Aug 2022
Interview Descriptions:
Overall a very nice experience. 
There is a pre-screen interview about 20 mins, the interviewer was super friendly. 
Then another formal interview with the team about 1 hour. There were a lot of questions about how to handle different situations. Everyone was very supportive and friendly which made me less nervous.
Interview Questions:
Do you know about our organization and our programs?
Why do you want to work here? 
What's your strength and weakness?

title: Placement Student Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Big Brothers Big Sisters
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was very fair and efficient. All communication that I received from the agency was clear and easy to understand. I felt the process was appropriate for the role that I was applying for.

title: Marketing Communications Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Big Brothers Big Sisters in Apr 2022
Interview Descriptions:
I initially applied through a virtual job application, where I sent in my resume & cover letter.
About a week later, I received a phone call where I was invited into the office for an interview.
The person who interviewed me was the Executive Director of the local branch. 
The questions mainly surrounded how well my previous marketing & event planning experience would align with the job responsibilities, and why I wanted to work for their non-profit specifically.

title: Community Engagement Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Big Brothers Big Sisters
Interview Descriptions: It was great very friendly people great conversation they were very welcoming and that was such a great experience to have that thank you so much for being so nice to me it is very appreciated
Interview Questions: How I feel being a part of a non profit

title: Volunteer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Big Brothers Big Sisters
Interview Descriptions: 1 hour interview with a kind and friendly coordinator asking the basic questions of how you found out about them, why you want to work and etc. Asked situational questions based on big brother program such as what would you do if your little was upset in public
Interview Questions: Why do you enjoy working with kids

title: Mentoring Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Big Brothers Big Sisters
Interview Descriptions: Applied online. Received an invitation to interview a week later. Interviewed by two people. Supervisor and another staff member.  Received a call for a second interview a week later. The second in-person interview was with supervisor and Exec Director. Received job offer within a week.
Interview Questions:
Tell me about yourself 
What do you know about our company?
Describe yourself in three adjectives
 Why do you want to work for our company?
What are your strengths? Weaknesses?
What keeps you motivated?
How do you keep organized? 
 How do you handle a chaotic environment/high-pressure environment?
What is your experience with crisis management?
 How do you handle criticism?
What is your ideal manager?

title: Admin Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Big Brothers Big Sisters (Orillia, ON) in Jun 2020
Interview Descriptions: I applied for the position through Indeed. I then received an email from indeed with a list of interview times/ dates that I could choose from. I then scheduled a zoom interview. I was told they might do second interviews but this did not happen. I was then offered the job a few days later.
Interview Questions: Tell me about myself, what past co-workers would say about me, a situation where I learned from a mistake

title: In-School Mentor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Big Brothers Big Sisters (Kitchener, ON) in Feb 2020
Interview Descriptions: I had applied online and they contacted me with the next steps within a week or so. There was an in-person interview followed by training the same day. I was matched with a mentee within a month or so.
Interview Questions: Why do you want this position?

title: Internship Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at Big Brothers Big Sisters (Victoria, BC) in Nov 2019
Interview Descriptions: Standardized List of Interview Questions with some room for conversation where it arose- able to accommodate doing it via Facetime which was very helpful. Relaxed interview but they did do a reference and background check as I would be in the building where children came even though I wasn't working with them.
Interview Questions: What are you three greatest strengths? And weaknesses?

title: Very Unnecessarily Long and Inconsiderate Process Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Big Brothers Big Sisters
Interview Descriptions: I first applied online to Big Brothers. I received a phone call where I did an initial screening. Then was told an outsourced recruitment agency would be performing the telephone interviews within 2 days. 2 days go by and no telephone interview. I called HR and they said perhaps in the next 2 days (again). Again, no call for a phone interview. I called again and asked. 1 week later I finally receive a call. There were some more delays here and there. Finally the telephone interview was complete. Next came an online test which took 1.5 hours. Then sending in documents. Then an in person interview which took around 1 hour. Afterwards, I had hoped that regardless of a job offer or not, I would hear back because I complied with jumping through many hoops to get the interview. I never heard back after the interview. It was a very disappointing and difficult process. If you can make it through all the interviews, skill testing and most of all, waiting and at the end receive a job offer, I suspect the job would be good. Because of the process of interviewing and overall communication though, I cannot be sure.
Interview Questions: What are 3 strengths and how it would be useful in this role?

title: Recruitment Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Big Brothers Big Sisters (Halifax, NS) in Jan 2018
Interview Descriptions: Great warm atmosphere. Organized, solid questions and the interviewer made me very comfortable. I was given prompt follow up, and their communication remained just as strong after I was hired. I could always do my best.
Interview Questions: What got you excited about this role and how do you see yourself contributing to our overall mission.

title: Marketing and Communications Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Big Brothers Big Sisters (Vancouver, BC) in Feb 2017
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview and then an in-person interview at their office. The phone interview was very friendly and casual, just a bit about myself and my experience and career interests. They asked me to bring in writing samples, design portfolio and an example of a previous social media campaign to the in-person interview, which was with their larger comms team.
Interview Questions: Walk through the process behind designing a previous social media campaign

title: Caseworker Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Big Brothers Big Sisters (Cambridge, ON)
Interview Descriptions: Great. Relaxing. Was interviewed by CEO and another staff. Interviewers were kind and personable in the interview. Asked standard interview questions about my previous experience and how it would apply to the position I was interviewing for. A few scenario questions. I think it took about 45 minutes.
Interview Questions: I don't remember the exact questions, but they were mostly about my previous experience relating to the role and some scenario questions. Also, brush up on child safety legislation + processes. They will likely ask questions pertaining to this, considering the nature of the organization is working with children.

title: Fundraiser Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Big Brothers Big Sisters in Jun 2016
Interview Descriptions: Very straightforward. Had a quick call with a manager, was brought in later that week for an interview. Interviewed with two people, took about an hour and heard back within ten days. Most of the questions were pretty standard but obviously be ready for a discussion about the organization's mission and mandate.
Interview Questions: Talk about a time when you had to deal with a work conflict.

title: Match Support Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Big Brothers Big Sisters (Toronto, ON) in May 2014
Interview Descriptions: Spoke with the Manager and Director for an hour and answered standard questions about working with children, having difficult conversations, and work-life balance. Completed a 30 minute case-management exercise after the interview.

title: Intake Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Big Brothers Big Sisters
Interview Descriptions: Received a phone call to come in for an interview. I was interviewed by the CEO and Supervisor who were gentle in their approach to help with interviewee feel relaxed. Were respectful and very communicative. The interview lasted about 45 minutes and they told me when I can expect to hear from them should I be the chosen candidate.
Interview Questions: List all resources are you familiar with in this city. There are so many in a large city so I listed the ones I knew that were related to families or children.
